content.description: A two-sample <math alttext="t " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference in means was conducted to investigate whether the average time to swim a lap with the freestyle stroke is different from the average time to swim a lap with the butterfly stroke. With all conditions for inference met, the test produced a test statistic of <math alttext="t equals negative 2.073" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow><mn>2.073</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.042.
content.question: Based on the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value and a significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following is a correct conclusion?

choices.label: There is convincing statistical evidence that the average time to swim a lap with the freestyle stroke is less than the average time to swim a lap with the butterfly stroke.
There is convincing statistical evidence that the average time to swim a lap with the freestyle stroke is different from the average time to swim a lap with the butterfly stroke.
There is not convincing statistical evidence that the average time to swim a lap with the freestyle stroke is greater than the average time to swim a lap with the butterfly stroke.
There is not convincing statistical evidence that the average time to swim a lap with the freestyle stroke is different from the average time to swim a lap with the butterfly stroke.
There is not convincing statistical evidence that the average time to swim a lap with the freestyle stroke is less than the average time to swim a lap with the butterfly stroke.

content.answer: There is convincing statistical evidence that the average time to swim a lap with the freestyle stroke is different from the average time to swim a lap with the butterfly stroke.

topic.text: 7.9: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Means

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
